title: Relative Pronouns Which, Where, And What

questions.question: This is the house .......................... I was born.
questions.description: Where can mean 'in which' or 'at which'.

questions.question: This is the town ....................... I spent my childhood.
This is the town .............................. I spent my childhood.
questions.description: Where can mean in which. Therefore, the first and the third options are possible here.

questions.question: Do you know a shop ............................ I can find sports shoes?
She got married again a few months later, ........................ surprised everybody.
questions.description: Which can refer to the whole of a previous clause.

questions.question: I was impressed by the way ............................. she did it.
We have got everything ............................ you ordered.
questions.description: What means 'the things which'. It cannot be used as an ordinary relative pronoun after a noun or pronoun.

questions.question: This is the school ......................... I studied.
She may be late ............................ case we ought to wait for her.
We moved to the country so that the kids would have a garden .........................
questions.description: Both options are possible here. The relative pronoun is dropped in an informal style and it is more common to use infinitive + preposition.

questions.question: This is the room .............................
questions.description: The structure with 'that' is common in an informal style.

questions.question: The idea ......................... she put forward was interesting.
